definition: to name/to christen/to take a name

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
erhua variant of 起名[qi3 ming2]

sentences.english: Makir's wife Maacah gave birth to a son and named him Peresh.
sentences.chinese: 玛吉的妻玛迦生了一个儿子，起名叫毗利施。

sentences.english: And she conceived again， and bare a son； and she called his name Onan.
sentences.chinese: 她又怀孕生了儿子，母亲给他起名叫俄南。
于是给他起名叫以萨迦。

sentences.english: And Maachah the wife of Machir bare a son, and she called his name Peresh;
sentences.chinese: 玛吉的妻玛迦生了一个儿子，起名叫毗利施。

sentences.english: Adam named his wife Eve, because she would become the mother of all the living.
sentences.chinese: 亚当给他妻子起名叫夏娃，因为她是众生之母。
我给我的猫起名叫塞勒姆。
你给你的儿子起名了吗？

sentences.english: So, I named him Myster (Mr.) Money.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我给他起名叫“钱先生”。

sentences.english: And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him, whom Sarah bare to him, Isaac.
sentences.chinese: 亚伯拉罕给撒拉所生的儿子起名叫以撒。

sentences.english: The woman gave birth to a boy and named him Samson.
sentences.chinese: 后来妇人生了一个儿子，给他起名叫参孙。

sentences.english: A friend named his architectural firm A. M. D. G.
sentences.chinese: 一位朋友给他的建筑设计公司起名AMDG。

sentences.english: This was named over the past summer.
sentences.chinese: 这个在去年夏天又重新起名了。

sentences.english: Moses built an altar and called it The Lord is my Banner.
sentences.chinese: 摩西筑了一座祭坛，给它起名叫“耶和华尼西”。

sentences.english: She named the old chimp David Greybeard.
sentences.chinese: 她给这只老黑猩猩起名叫灰胡子大卫。

sentences.english: She became pregnant and gave birth to a son, who was named Er.
sentences.chinese: 她就怀孕生了儿子，犹大给他起名叫珥。

sentences.english: So it got the name city of rocks.
sentences.chinese: 所以呢就起名叫石头城。

definition: to name/to be named/to christen/to seek fame
erhua variant of 起名[qi3 ming2]
to change one's name
homonym/homophone/harmonic (component of sound)
pet name for a child/childhood name
to give a name to/to dub/to christen/to designate/named after/naming
easy to remember
one's birth data for astrological purposes, combined from year, month, day, hour, heavenly trunk and earthly branch
to have one's fortune read/system of fortune telling based on a person's date and time of birth, according to 干支 (sexagenary cycle)
stage name (of an actor or actress)
family name/surname/CL:個|个[ge4]/to be surnamed
renowned/a great name
family name
pet name for a child/infant name
to tell sb's fortune
origin
